derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin excogitat- 'found by process of thought', from the verb excogitare, from ex- 'out' + cogitare 'think'

means.word_mean: 1. come up with (an idea, plan, explanation, theory, or priciple) after a mental effort;

sentences.sentence: "excogitate a way to measure the speed of light"
"I mulled over the events of the afternoon"
"philosophers have speculated on the question of God for thousands of years"
"The scientist must stop to observe and start to excogitate"
